title: pdf specimen of FF Bau?
content:
hello

im looking for a pdf-specimen of FF Bau (with the g of ff bau super!). im working on a fun-project, just got a few letters done of an extra-bold grotesque. i dont want to copy ff bau, but i know that i want a 2-story-g and i wanted to have a close look at FF bau for that one - im not that experienced, thus this could be a good help.

but i cant find it on orangeitalic or the FS-homepage. any help?

 [‹ Open Type Helvetica for all european languages?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120225148/http:/typophile.com/node/19476 "Go to previous forum topic") [readerability / readability ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120225148/http:/typophile.com/node/14373 "Go to next forum topic")
author: thierry blancpain

comments.content:
[Is this close enough?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120225148/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11312.4.25&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=g&sampleSize=388)

And here’s the alt lc ’g’ of [FF Super Grotesk Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120225148/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11133.6.27&attributes.sampleSize=388&sampleText=g+&sampleSize=388).

yes, this is perfect. i hate the FS-website in terms of easy usability..

thanks alot!

if you know any other old grotesque double-story g, feel free to post samples!
Usability? Can you explain? I searched for FF Bau, clicked on the Super weight, typed a ’g’ in the sample field and selected 388 pts. Would love to hear how that could be easier.

1. load [www.fontshop.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120225148/http:/www.fontshop.de/ "www.fontshop.de")  
2. select “Schriften” in the main menu (fonts)  
3. type “FF bau” in the search form  
4. click on FF bau  
5. land on a (unlinkable) page with flash-content where i cannot find a link to bigger glyph versions or a textfield where i can select a typesize..

oh now.. fontshop.com is SO much better than fontshop.de. so yes, it is very easy to find on fontshop.com. should’ve tried it there.
